children.comment: Everything in Dart is an [Object].
children.name: Object

children.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all [Object]s is to return true if and
only if [:this:] and [other] are the same object.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override
the [hashCode] method as well to maintain consistency.
Returns a string representation of this object.
children.name: toString

children.comment:
[noSuchMethod] is invoked when users invoke a non-existant method
on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the
invocation are passed to [noSuchMethod] in an [Invocation].
If [noSuchMethod] returns a value, that value becomes the result of
the original invocation.

The default behavior of [noSuchMethod] is to throw a
[noSuchMethodError].
children.name: noSuchMethod

children.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the
same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality
operator [:==:]. Other than that there are no guarantees about
the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and
there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides [hashCode] it should override the
equality operator as well to maintain consistency.
children.name: hashCode

children.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.
children.name: runtimeType

children.comment:
Creates a new [Object] instance.

[Object] instances have no meaningful state, and are only useful
through their identity. An [Object] instance is equal to itself
only.
children.name: Object

children.comment:
Resets the runing variables from the params
Used once at the start (total reset) and for the repeat effect (partial reset)
children.name: reset
synthWave

children.comment: Shape of the wave (0:square, 1:saw, 2:sin or 3:noise)
children.name: waveType

children.comment: Length of the volume envelope attack (0 to 1)
children.name: attackTime

children.comment: Length of the volume envelope sustain (0 to 1)
children.name: sustainTime

children.comment: Tilts the sustain envelope for more 'pop' (0 to 1)
children.name: sustainPunch

children.comment: Length of the volume envelope decay (yes, I know it's called release) (0 to 1)
children.name: decayTime

children.comment: Base note of the sound (0 to 1)
children.name: startFrequency

children.comment: If sliding, the sound will stop at this frequency, to prevent really low notes (0 to 1)
children.name: minFrequency

children.comment: Slides the note up or down (-1 to 1)
children.name: slide

children.comment: Accelerates the slide (-1 to 1)
children.name: deltaSlide

children.comment: Strength of the vibrato effect (0 to 1)
children.name: vibratoDepth

children.comment: Speed of the vibrato effect (i.e. frequency) (0 to 1)
children.name: vibratoSpeed

children.comment: Shift in note, either up or down (-1 to 1)
children.name: changeAmount

children.comment: How fast the note shift happens (only happens once) (0 to 1)
children.name: changeSpeed

children.comment: Controls the ratio between the up and down states of the square wave, changing the tibre (0 to 1)
children.name: squareDuty

children.comment: Sweeps the duty up or down (-1 to 1)
children.name: dutySweep

children.comment: Speed of the note repeating - certain variables are reset each time (0 to 1)
children.name: repeatSpeed

children.comment: Offsets a second copy of the wave by a small phase, changing the tibre (-1 to 1)
children.name: phaserOffset

children.comment: Sweeps the phase up or down (-1 to 1)
children.name: phaserSweep

children.comment: Frequency at which the low-pass filter starts attenuating higher frequencies (0 to 1)
children.name: lpFilterCutoff

children.comment: Sweeps the low-pass cutoff up or down (-1 to 1)
children.name: lpFilterCutoffSweep

children.comment: Changes the attenuation rate for the low-pass filter, changing the timbre (0 to 1)
children.name: lpFilterResonance

children.comment: Frequency at which the high-pass filter starts attenuating lower frequencies (0 to 1)
children.name: hpFilterCutoff

children.comment: Sweeps the high-pass cutoff up or down (-1 to 1)
children.name: hpFilterCutoffSweep

children.comment: Overall volume of the sound (0 to 1)
children.name: masterVolume
SfxrParams.fromString

children.comment: Sets the parameters to generate a pickup/coin sound
children.name: SfxrParams.generatePickupCoin

children.comment:
Take a snapshot of the manager. Snapshot includes:
Loaded clips
Sources
Volume
children.name: takeSnapshot

children.comment: Load a snapshot of the manager.
children.name: loadSnapshot

children.comment:
The [AudioManager] class is the main entry point to the [simple_audio]
library. You can create [AudioClip]s and [AudioSource]s with the manager.
You can play clips from sources with the manager.

The [AudioManager] also has a listener which picks up sounds from
[AudioSource]s. The sound picked up by the listener from the [AudioSource]s
is played through the real, physical speakers attached to the computer.
children.name: AudioManager

children.comment: Set the music volume.
children.name: musicVolume=

children.comment: Set the master volume.
children.name: masterVolume=

children.comment: Set the sources volume
children.name: sourceVolume=

children.comment: Control the master mute
children.name: mute=

children.comment: Pause both music and source based sounds.
children.name: pauseAll

children.comment: Resume both music and source based sounds.
children.name: resumeAll

children.comment: Pause music sounds
children.name: pauseMusic

children.comment: Resume music sounds
children.name: resumeMusic

children.comment: Pause source base sounds.
children.name: pauseSources

children.comment: Resume source base sounds.
children.name: resumeSources

children.comment: Find the audio clip with [name]
children.name: findClip

children.comment: Find the audio source with [name]
children.name: findSource

children.comment: Create an [AudioClip] with [name].
children.name: makeClip

children.comment: Batch create many clips.
children.name: makeClips

children.comment:
Batch load all clips not marked as ready to play.
Returns a single Future which will complete once all the clips have loaded.
children.name: loadClips

children.comment: Create an [AudioSource] and assign it [name]
children.name: makeSource

children.comment: Play [clipName] from [sourceName].
children.name: playClipFromSource

children.comment: Play [clipName] from [sourceName] in [delay] seconds.
children.name: playClipFromSourceIn

children.comment: Stop all sounds originating from [sourceName]
children.name: stopSource

children.comment: Pause all sounds originating from [sourceName]
children.name: pauseSource

children.comment: Resume all sounds originating from [sourceName]
children.name: resumeSource

children.comment: Sample rate of the audio driver
children.name: sampleRate

children.comment: Get the music volume.
children.name: musicVolume

children.comment: Get the master volume.
children.name: masterVolume

children.comment: Get the sources volume
children.name: sourceVolume

children.comment: Is the master volume muted?
children.name: mute

children.comment: Get the [AudioMusic] singleton.
children.name: music

children.comment:
Construct a new AudioManager,
can specify [baseURL] which is prepended to all clip URLs.
[baseURL] defaults to '/'
children.name: AudioManager

children.comment: [AudioMusic] plays a clip from an omnidirectional [AudioSource].
children.name: AudioMusic

children.comment: Pause or unpause the music
children.name: pause=

children.comment: Play the music clip. The music will loop.
children.name: play

children.comment: Crossfades linear to the music [clip] with [delay] and [fadeDuration]. The music will loop.
children.name: crossFadeLinear

children.comment: Stop the music.
children.name: stop

children.comment: Is the music paused?
children.name: pause

children.comment:
[AudioSound] is an [AudioClip] scheduled to be played on an [AudioSource].
You cannot construct an instance of the [AudioSound] class directly, it can only be
done by playing an [AudioClip] from an [AudioSource] (See [AudioSource], [AudioMusic], and [AudioManager]).
children.name: AudioSound

children.comment: Pause or unpause the sound.
children.name: pause=

children.comment: Start playing this sound in [when] seconds.
children.name: play

children.comment: Fading linear IN this sound with [delay] and the [fadeDuration] with [volume] and [playFromStart] or just unpause
children.name: fadeIn

children.comment: Fading linear this sound with [delay] and the [fadeDuration] out and [doPause] or just stop
children.name: fadeOut

children.comment: Starts fading linear this sound with [delay] and the [fadeDuration] till it reaches the [targetFadeVolumen]
children.name: fade

children.comment: Stop playing this sound
children.name: stop

children.comment: Set the volume for the sound.
children.name: volume=

children.comment: Is the sound scheduled to be played?
children.name: isScheduled

children.comment: Is the sound playing right now?
children.name: isPlaying

children.comment: Is the sound finished being played?
children.name: isFinished

children.comment: Is the sound paused?
children.name: pause

children.comment:
Time cursor for sound. Will be negative is sound is scheduled
to be played. Positive if playing.
children.name: time

children.comment: Get the volume of the sound. 0.0 <= volume <= 1.0.
children.name: volume

children.comment:
An [AudioSource] is analogous to a speaker in the game world.

The only way to play an [AudioClip] is with an [AudioSource].

An [AudioSource] can be [positional] or not. Positional [AudioSource]s
sound different depending on where the listener is. Non-positional
[AudioSource]s sound the same regarldess of where the listener is.
The location of the listener can be controlled with an [AudioManager].


*NOTE:* By default an [AudioSource] is [positional].
children.name: AudioSource

children.comment: Set the volume for the source. All sounds being played are affected.
children.name: volume=

children.comment: Mute or unmute the source.
children.name: mute=

children.comment: Play [clip] from the source.
children.name: playOnce

children.comment: Play [clip] from the source starting in [delay] seconds.
children.name: playOnceIn

children.comment: Play [clip] from the source in a loop.
children.name: playLooped

children.comment:
Play [clip] from the source in a loop starting in [delay]
seconds.
children.name: playLoopedIn

children.comment: Pause or resume the source
children.name: pause=

children.comment: Stop the source. Affects all playing and scheduled sounds.
children.name: stop

children.comment: Set the position of the source.
children.name: setPosition

children.comment: Set the linear velocity of the source.
children.name: setVelocity

children.comment: Get the volume of the source. 0.0 <= volume <= 1.0.
children.name: volume

children.comment: Is the source muted?
children.name: mute

children.comment: Is the source currently paused?
children.name: pause

children.comment: X position of the source.
children.name: x

children.comment: Y position of the source.
children.name: y

children.comment: Z position of the source.
children.name: z

children.comment:
An [AudioClip] stores sound data. To play an [AudioClip],
see [AudioSource], [AudioMusic], and [AudioManager].
children.name: AudioClip

children.comment: Clear any error.
children.name: clearError

children.comment:
Fetch and decode the clip's [url] into the clip buffer.
Returns a [Future<AudioClip>] which completes to *this*.
[hasError] and [errorString] will indicate and explain respetively
any load errors.
children.name: load

children.comment:
Make an empty clip buffer with [numberOfSampleFrames] in
each [numberOfChannels]. The buffer plays at a rate of [sampleRate].
The duration (in seconds) of the buffer is equal to:
numberOfSampleFrames / sampleRate
children.name: makeBuffer

children.comment:
Return the sample frames array for [channel]. Assuming a stereo setup,
the left and right speakers are mapped to channel 0 and 1 respectively.
children.name: getSampleFramesForChannel

children.comment: Does the clip have an error?
children.name: hasError

children.comment: Human readable error
children.name: errorString

children.comment: Number of clip channels.
children.name: numberOfChannels

children.comment: Length of clip in seconds.
children.name: length

children.comment: Length of clip in samples.
children.name: samples

children.comment: Samples per second.
children.name: frequency

children.comment: Is the clip ready to be played?
children.name: isReadyToPlay
